Interesting Links #7

10 Feb 2014
  • Your Progress As A Programmer Is All Up To You - follow your passion, never stop learning and share your ideas
  • JointJS - the HTML 5 JavaScript diagramming library. - one of the prettiest I've seen
  • Strapfork - "Now you can use Bootstrap, Nobody will Notice" unless they're a designer, coder etc...
  • When should I not kill -9 a process? - try kill -15 first
  • Tether - JS lib for making an absolutely positioned element stay next to another element. Also links some projects built with it

Introduction

09 Feb 2014

I've gotten myself into the situation where I have been bookmarking lots of seemingly interesting articles, blogs, repos etc... and not actually following up and looking at them. Probably because I think I don't have the time. Which is a big fat lie.

So to break the cycle, I'm going to regularly publish short lists of my bookmarks that are actually of interest to me - I'll know this because I will have looked them. (I've been doing this for a short while to see if I'd actually do it.)

I'll probably blog occasionally too.

Hopefully there may be some stuff of interest in here for you too.

Interesting links #6

08 Feb 2014
  • Oboe.js - a library that runs under Node.js and web browsers for loading JSON using streaming, also some sweet sweet SVG animations
  • Process is Poison - automate your process, don't have bad process make more process
  • 5 Whys - Your 5 year-old is onto something. (Linked from "Process is Poison" and worth including separately.)
  • Multi-Threaded Programming 1: Basics - begining of a series that looks interesting
  • Procedural Dungeon Generation Explained - demo and follow up to an earlier post
  • Game Design Patterns and Anti-Patterns for Turn-Based Strategy Games - a topic close to my heart.

Interesting links #5

07 Feb 2014
  • Ruby's bitwise operators - good intro
  • The DCI Architecture: A New Vision of Object-Oriented Programming - on my 'to read' list
  • vimtronner - a multiplayer, real-time, command-line game that teaches you the core vim keys - maybe this year I'll learn VIM
  • ArrrrCamp 2013 - Patters to deal with big ActiveRecord models - an interesting watch as it covers multiple techniques for if you can't handle lots of code in one file.
  • Stripe Blog: CTF3 Architecture - always interesting to see behind the curtain
